description:
【主讲老师简介】

老师沪江用户名：CiciDiCicco
Cici老师，大学讲师职称。多年教授高校英语口语，语音，商务英语课程。旅居美国数年。语音纯正，见解独到。善于启发学生思维，用英语讲有趣的事。
Corey老师，美国人。汉语国际教育硕士学历。汉语流利。国内学习期间从事英语教学工作5年。了解中国学生的特点。

【课程展示】

更多课程直播，戳我下载CCtalk>>>和大家一起快乐学！

【课程重点】

Pinyin or English?

The Hangzhou government compiled a pamphlet for its residents ahead of the G20 summit held in September in Hangzhou, Zhejiang Province. Titled To Quickly Memorize 100 English Sentences, the pamphlet teaches residents how to say some common English expressions by using pinyin that sounds similar. "'Welcome to Hangzhou" was 'wai kan mu tu Hangzhou,"      

Discussion

Is it a quick way to learn English for beginners? What do you think?

What are the two active parts and two passive parts of language ability?

What is a balanced bilingual?

What are the three general types of bilingualism?

What processes are the left hemisphere more active with? What processes are the right hemisphere more active with?

What are the visible advantages of being multilingual?

What diseases can a bilingual delay?

Being bilingual, what executive functions can people practice?

What three languages would you really like to speak, and why?

What good and bad experiences have you had learning English?

Why are some people better at learning than others?

Do you have any learning difficulties?

What tips on learning would you give to other people?

TED演讲也谈到过“掌握双语对大脑”的好处这一话题哦~视频戳>>>
